text:
Possible bug report here, wanted to see if anyone else has encountered it.

My theme footer has a dnd area with a dnd partial in it

```{% dnd_area "footer_contact"
label="Footer",  
class="footer_contact white_text"
%}

{# Contact Field #}


{% include_dnd_partial path="../../sections/call-to-action.html" context={
'content': '<center><h4>Label</h4><h3>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Etiam vehicula </h3></center>',
'background_setter': theme.global_colors.primary.color,
'form_id':'96653c19-0674-4a44-b9f0-8c17addaa8f5'
       } %}

{% end_dnd_area %}```
This works fine but when I try to edit my blog-post template I get the error:

`line 82: Blog Post templates cannot contain drag and drop areas`

If I replace the partial in the footer with the actual content of the partial, the error goes away.

The downside of that is that I lose the ability to give the section a class. I suppose my workaround will be to just wrap the dnd_area in a div

I've tested with boilerplate sections and I'm getting the same results
Blog Posts don't currently support DND, you can <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Drag-amp-Drop-functionality-for-Blog-Posts/idi-p/408909|see more here>
